intro: Hieracium tenue, commonly known as slender hawkweed, is a low-growing perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters and has basal leaves that are lance-shaped with hairy surfaces. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, and the stems are usually reddish or purple in color. Hieracium tenue is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade.
